meanings.definition: Resembling a log in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The loggish pillow was so round and fat.
meanings.sent2: The tree stump had a loggish shape.
meanings.sent3: The loggish cloud lazily floated across the sky.
meanings.sent4: His loggish movements made him blend in with the forest.
meanings.sent5: The loggish rock sat still by the riverbank.

meanings.definition: Moving or acting slowly and heavily, like a log.
meanings.sent1: The tired bear moved in a loggish manner.
meanings.sent2: The old dog walked loggishly towards its bed.
meanings.sent3: The loggish sloth took its time climbing the tree.
meanings.sent4: The loggish elephant trudged through the muddy swamp.
meanings.sent5: The loggish turtle slowly made its way to the water.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of energy or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: She gave a loggish response to the exciting news.
meanings.sent2: The students looked loggish during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent3: His loggish wave goodbye indicated his tiredness.
meanings.sent4: The loggish cat barely lifted its head to meow.
meanings.sent5: The loggish sloth barely moved in its tree.
